titleStmt.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to John Hay, October 5, 1880

bibl.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to John Hay
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia,
October 5, 1880.
Mr. J. H. Smyth to the Ass't Sec'y of State.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia,
October 5, 1880.
I have the honor to respectfully call attention to the fact that my quarterly returns for the 4th quarter ending June 30, 1880, were forwarded by Mr. M. A. Aenmey, U.S. V.C.G.
You will please find in addition enclosed, marked #1, my abstract of contingent expenses with vouchers.

'My actual expenses' in obtaining
Hon. John Hay,
Assistant Secretary of State
Washington, D.C.
obtaining the information for my commercial report under art. 24, sec. 381, Consular Regulations, exceeded by some dollars the am't allowed by law, and this money was expended at different times during the six months preceding the compilation of the report.

I am, Sir,
Your obd't servt,
Jno. H. Smyth, U.S. Consul General
